body:
@alexbrainman : The compiler complains that sleep() is an undefined function. To demonstrate the problem, compile Go on a 32-bit Windows system using the compiler at http://tdm-gcc.tdragon.net/

@minux: Two observations:

1. You include windows.h. Which logically presupposes that you want the Windows API call, and not whatever mingw may provide.
2. I have been told in other patches to prefer the Windows API, as opposed to whatever compatibility layer may be provided by a compiler.

Also:

1. Either the code is not actually getting compiled on 32-bit because it doesn't support the code paths that expose the test OR
2. The compiler at http://tdm-gcc.tdragon.net/ does not provide the sleep() compatibility function.
